newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Forint eases vs dlr, market awaits Pannon bonds.
newsitem.headline: Forint eases vs dlr, market awaits Pannon bonds.

text.p: Hungary's forint closed weaker against the dollar on Wednesday but fluctuated against the currency basket amid domestic speculation, dealers said.
The forint finished 30 pips from the central bank resistance level at 174.87/92 against the dollar, compared to a noon level of 174.80/85 and an opening of 174.35/40.

"The forint moved about quite a bit within the currency basket, moving up to 50 points below the resistance level," said Attila Behan of ING Bank. "There was more than the usual amount of domestic speculation."

Behan said that next week's ING Barings-managed issue by Hungarian mobile telephone company Pannon GSM of inflation-indexed bonds totalling a record 24 billion forints nominal value will attract more dollar buyers than sellers over the next few days pushing the forint back to the resistance level.
"Foreign investors in forints will find good rates next week," he said.
Pannon will auction three-year, four-year and five-year bonds of eight billion forints nominal value for each series on Wednesday, February 26. -- Duncan Shiels, Budapest newsroom (361) 327 4040
